NAME: albert-riera-galceran
DESCRIPTION: My practice bounces between art and design. I like to explore the relationship with this two worlds and always bring it into a personal place in which to express my emotions in everything I create.

NAME: alex-liu
CATEGORIES: moving image  typograhy  service design  experience design

NAME: alva-skog
DESCRIPTION: Illustration is a way for me to communicate, express and question ideas and ideals. My wish is to highlight and challenge social issues in society and contribute to the much-needed diversity in media and advertising. I want people to reflect on things that we take for granted, such as gender in-equality and hidden racism. My name is Alva Skog. I am an illustrator and graphic designer from Stockholm, Sweden. In 2017, I was awarded a yellow pencil in the D&Ad New Blood Awards. In 2018 I am highly commended in the V&A Illustration Awards and shortlisted in the Penguin Student Design Awards. My work has been exhibited twice at Cluster Arts Illustration edition II and III in Shoreditch, London, UK.

NAME: alyandra-katya-mangkuningrat
DESCRIPTION: My work involves pushing the boundaries of functionality to convey information (mainly social and environmental issues), stimulate conversation, and aid efficiency.

NAME: anatoly-shabalin
DESCRIPTION: I am a multidisciplinary artist mostly focused on typography and branding. I experiment with different types of printing. In my work I try to combine digital and analog skills.

NAME: andreas-hansson
DESCRIPTION: I design motion and narratives in homage to the small things. There is a mysticism and quirkyness to the everyday and seemingly insignificant which I enjoy investigating. Animation is a world with endless opportunities to share the findings.

NAME: andreas-pappamikail
DESCRIPTION:
My design process is research oriented, blending a methodological analysis of contemporary events and communicating my findings using the tools of modern media & technologies.
As such I would describe my work more as a sort of investigative design, trying to challenge and question some of our existing beliefs and conceptions, carefully demystifying some core frameworks of our contemporary society.

NAME: anna-ju
CATEGORIES: publication art direction campaign typography copywriting
DESCRIPTION: I design and create. I aim to inspire and influence the audience, mainly focusing to achieve thorough communication and promotion.

NAME: annabel-lake
DESCRIPTION: My design practice embodies a playful design discourse that aims to create engaging and emphatic outcomes in an accessible way. My design intention raises questions about our relationship with technology, our well-being and our connection with our environment, all with the purpose of making a positive impact on the world. Crossing many different disciplines from identity, to photography, motion graphics, and user experience design. I believe that there is an inherent balance between the digital and physical, experimentation, strategy and the ethics of design.

NAME: annie-tinsley
DESCRIPTION: I focus on the body and self through photography and film (although not limited to these media) to address conceptual provocations or as a representation via metaphor. I aim to emphasis the power and status of the female form in my work.

NAME: anoushka-khandwala
CATEGORIES: interactive  writing  typography  photography  publication  printmaking  installation
DESCRIPTION: My practice explores how user interaction can be used to spread awareness of social issues. In terms of media, I work across disciplines from physical computing to illustration, all whilst considering the audience's experience.

NAME: anri-tanaka
DESCRIPTION: My work usually focuses on tackling themes such as animal activism and sustainability in a gentle  but thought-provoking way. I execute this with sequential hand-drawn illustration, ink, watercolour and print-making elements, sometimes involving photography, 3D work and other methods. I also like incorporating narratives, astronomy and medical related things in my work.

NAME: asel-tambay
DESCRIPTION: My work is a visual study of language where words become objects, performers, meanings, places and characters. The way I use language becomes a way of curating language as I’m interested in re-using, re-positioning and re-purposing language in different settings.

NAME: ashley-gan
DESCRIPTION: I like printed matter :)

NAME: beatriz-camargo
DESCRIPTION: My body of work is focused on social issues and is designed in ways to make people aware of certain causes: to engage, interact, intrigue, make people reflect and put themselves in the shoes of others.I’m especially interested in UX design and believe that to create the best experience, designers must empathize with the cause and specific audience they are designing for.

NAME: bee-supavarasuwat
DESCRIPTION: The focus of my work is to make people happy. Mainly through making film and interactive design.

NAME: beli-heredero
DESCRIPTION: Inter-disciplinary designer that combines illustration and typography as a means to engage, communicate and entertain.

NAME: benjamin-chan
DESCRIPTION: Graphic and interaction designer, exploring the space between digital and physical in an experimental and playful way.

NAME: brenna-mcguirk
DESCRIPTION: To provoke or challenge every day norms my work revolves around testing how far I can go to push the perspectives of right and right on social issues.

NAME: c.-victoria-reis
DESCRIPTION: I am a multidisciplinar, advertising is my pasion as well as being a designer. Problem solver, every industry needs design and a voice to comunicate ideas, products , campaings etc.I do what I do with love to inspire and inovate everyday.

NAME: carolina-pereira-doria
DESCRIPTION: Carolina and Paula, a creative team interested in generating a positive social impact. We believe that through simplicity we can create meaningful messages.

NAME: carson-wong
DESCRIPTION: I try to make creative and interesting imagery through illustration, and explored strategy of advertising

NAME: chalisa-visudharomn
DESCRIPTION: I aim to create work that provokes thought, emotion or tells a story. I enjoy using different medias like film, photography and illustration as well as experimenting with ones I haven't tried.

NAME: chayaporn-navintum
DESCRIPTION: I am a multidisciplinary designer with interests in different areas, such as photography, animation, illustration and more. Experimenting with mixed media and different techniques to discipline and improve my design skills.

NAME: chris-baker
DESCRIPTION:
In my practice I wanted to explore the relationship between the physical and the digital. I’m particularly interested in how that can be utilised to make more immersive and more dynamic identities and brand experiences across multiple touch points.

For me, the Degree Show Identity is a perfect summation of my practice and the kind of work I envisage doing. This live identity thrives on user interaction and actively encourages social media engagement and the identity itself responds to that information. Meaning users feel engaged and feel like they’re part of something when they can see their input have an impact in a digital or a physical environment.

NAME: christina-twigg
CATEGORIES: typography  print  publication  photography  bookbinding  publication
DESCRIPTION: Concept-driven designer with a particular focus on typography and print. My work aims to engage and inform the audience with an interactive approach.

NAME: cindy-chang
DESCRIPTION: I'd like to make the world a better place but that requires everyone's participation. As a graphic designer, I get everyone to partake by creating work that puts a smile (or even better, a laugh) on their faces.

NAME: conrad-haddaway
DESCRIPTION: One half of the Sherwin + Conrad Advertising duo. Ex Marine Biologist. As Creatives soon to be out in the industry, we feel that it’s extremely important to be able to communicate and understand culture in hundreds of ever-changing ways. We try our best to seekout previously unexplored territories, insights and executions in advertising. We favour outcomes which stay true to our original insights and aren’t forcibly stretched across unnecessary media.

NAME: daeun-jeong
DESCRIPTION: My practice focuses on telling the story though the photography. I love to capture the moments of daily life and narrative around simple objects. I enjoy combining pure graphic design with photography to create the visual languages.

NAME: daragh-anderson
CATEGORIES: installation animation interactive writing campaign typography publication
DESCRIPTION: Using visual design and creative coding to simplify and inspire new ways of looking at complex ideas. I believe in the importance of exploring how design can inspire and provide access to esoteric scientific principles and vast amounts of new information. Educating designers to explore this brave new world of complexity as well as showing scientists the value of visual design in problem solving and communication will be vital in making sense of the most difficult problems emerging from an increasingly plural future.

NAME: dilruba-tayfun
DESCRIPTION: Fusing magic and realism. Attempting to bring to light the invisible and abiding elements in our environments and human journeys. Story-telling and reporting on our interactions with our environments and each other, via journalling, illustrating and animating. I stumble upon my projects through everyday journeying (not necessarily far and in the traditional sense). Usually foraging for essence, energy and connection. Depending on the subject I'm illustrating, my mark-making tools are often either foraged or locally found.

NAME: eden-lily-hardy
CATEGORIES: installation animation photography writing typography publication
DESCRIPTION: A process led, cross-disciplinary designer with interests in fields that span typography, image-making and publishing. My practice is fuelled by research and experimentation, often balancing both digital and analogue forms.

NAME: elisa-trimarchi
DESCRIPTION: I am a graphic designer and illustrator. My practice is heavily centred around the use of analogue processes and referencing design techniques that aren’t as prevalent in the current design climate as they used to be. That being said, I like to combine contemporary ideals and methods with traditional means of production - communicating a point whilst evoking nostalgia.

NAME: elizabeth-critchlow
DESCRIPTION: my work is political yet visually bright and playful. I am interested in unconventional and accessible printmaking techniques, whether it is possible to design for "free", and experimental typography.

NAME: ella-rose-squires
DESCRIPTION: I’m Ella. I am based in London. I like to capture every day life. Beauty in the ordinary.

NAME: ellen-jonsson
DESCRIPTION: With language and typography at its centre, my practice combines old and new technologies to create meaningful systems of communication design. I believe that the role of the designer is a privileged one, a conviction which makes me want to create responsible and relevant work for the future.

NAME: elsa-blanchard
DESCRIPTION:
I specify in Moving Image, and I am particularly interested in documentary photography and documentary filmmaking. I feel that I can situate my practice in the documentary field, using pictures or interviews with people involved in real events to provide a factual report on a particular subject.
I find my inspiration in people living around me but also throughtravelling and discovering new places.

NAME: etta-voorsanger-brill
DESCRIPTION: I am Graphic Designer, Printmaker and Illustrator who is interested in self publishing . My work centres around the intersection of typography, printmaking (namely using the Risograph / Xerox Machines)  and Feminism. Her graphic language remains playful and bright while exploring graphic designs contribution to equality.

NAME: florentin-aisslinger
DESCRIPTION: For me the challenge and excitement within design lies not only in the visual communication and problem solving, but in creating speculative scenarios and spaces that essentially ask more questions rather than try to offer answers. I have the ambition to merge this gab between graphic design and spacial installations by developing a meaningful interplay between people, technology, data systems and culture. Through this journey of explorations, the question of what it means to be ‘human’ stands at the very core of my work. Exploring how designers and artists can use objects, stories and technologies to question and challenge the long established dichotomies between the body and the environment, the self and the other, as well as external and internal truths. I hope that these spaces can become a catalyst for collectively redefining our relationship with our emotional, social and material reality.

NAME: hailey-hyesu-lee
DESCRIPTION: As a designer, my work aims to inform and educate audiences — I hope to bring out and the raise awareness of various issues in a social context and expose positive changes.

NAME: hana-jin-
DESCRIPTION: My work reflects observations that I make as a member of the society. As a designer, I’m interested in translating human behaviours and recognition into communicative visual forms.

NAME: hanyu-fu
DESCRIPTION: I am Hanyu, who is interest in narrative animation and illustration, experimental film and sound-design.

NAME: harriet-godfrey-white
DESCRIPTION: I am interested in form, space and trace. To explore these themes, I have based my work on the human body. I experimented with direct documentation such as body prints, casting, and photography. I also consider the space outside of the body in terms spacial boundries, composition and social conditions. Architecture is a key element of this, and heavily influenced my thinking towards structuring, organising and understanding form and space, not only associated with the human body but design in general. My work aims to challenge the way we typically consider space by exploring the human body as an object to speculate.

NAME: indiana-lawrence
DESCRIPTION: I use materials and methods in unconventional ways to produce playful, engaging work spanning graphic design, photography and printmaking. I’m fascinated by the ordinary, overlooked and unassuming.

NAME: inês-mena-silva
DESCRIPTION: My practice focuses on using experimentation, theory and research to create critical and speculative objects. I usually work across disciplines and under close collaboration with different practitioners to push and expand graphic design towards my main interests: Curation, Publishing and Critical Writing.

NAME: ingūna-ziemele
DESCRIPTION: Telling visual stories through comedy.

NAME: irene-albino
DESCRIPTION: I never thought I would be involved in weaving activities, even less in knitting. But there is something about the physicality and the material that always makes me want to touch things and build stuff. In the process of making, I only use technologies as a mean to experiment with concepts that at first glance seem disconnected. Those connections are usually given within the words/concepts themselves. Weaving code, performing time, arranging silence, design for all the projects I never did and for a society that moves beyond gender..what if, and why not.

NAME: isobel-guy
DESCRIPTION: Informed by research and experimentation my practice is characterised with both analogue and digital explorations around typography.

NAME: isobel-orton
DESCRIPTION: As a designer my work lies between design and illustration - I continually experiment and take risk  to find ways of fusing and blending these two disciplines. I am excited by the ‘handmade’ — by creating and crafting something tangible and tactile is, in my opinion, an antidote to the sheer abundance of information in the digital age. Many of the concepts I explore challenge ‘every-day’ perceptions and social-disparities.

NAME: jacqueline-zee
DESCRIPTION: An illustrator and designer working in physical and ephemeral graphics to create narratives of space and intimacy

NAME: jade-lee-ann-stephens
DESCRIPTION: I am a versatile designer who is accomplished in a range of media merging photography with innovative design. For me, design should be both aesthically pleasing and thought provoking.

NAME: james-moore
DESCRIPTION: Mainly using paint as my medium my work focusses on human emotions and identity. I use colour to both diguise and reveal emotions and characters that often represent the way i feel or the feeling i get from others.

NAME: jamie-yoonyoung-jung
DESCRIPTION: I'm highly interested in constructing narratives and speculating/ knowing what impact a project brings to the audience it engages with. My work is driven by observing human behaviours & emotions, and aims to translate those observations into a narrative that provokes empathy for those who encounters it.

NAME: jasmine-leung
CATEGORIES: print-making installation film animation photography writing performance
DESCRIPTION: I’m interested in the human experience, whether it is good or bad, and often wonder at the things that make us human.  I also ponder the subjectivity of human experiences, such as considering how people experience things, why they experience them that way, and how it affects their perception and opinion of things.  I walk the line between art and design and my work constantly preoccupies itself around these questions and reflections about the human condition.

NAME: jordan-smith
DESCRIPTION: My main focus as a designer lies within identity design. I like to combine bold ideas with traditional pure graphic design aesthetics to create personality-rich visual languages.

NAME: julia-lópez-martínez
DESCRIPTION: My work lives within the worlds of moving image and illustration. It explores the translation of images and concepts into their 3d version. I like to reuse and reinvent materials experimenting with new media and crafts, making use of playfulness and generating absurd situations.

NAME: justin-wong
DESCRIPTION: Immersive little cinema for short films and ads.  I tell stories.

NAME: kate-yu
DESCRIPTION: As an advertising creative, I believe advertising is the way to better communicate and connect people. I want to raise awareness in a creative way and educate people to view things differently.

NAME: kateryna-logvynenko
DESCRIPTION: I am an illustrator and a graphic designer mostly focused on traditional illustration (tattoo-like dotwork realism mostly, academic pencil drawing, ink, watercolour). I am interested in book illustration, particularly children's books, storytelling, psychology of visual perception and visual influence.

NAME: katherine-easthill
DESCRIPTION:
Recent graduate of the BA Graphic Communication course at Central Saint Martins. My work is primarily focused on typography and print. With interests in other aspects of publications for example writing, editing and selecting content. I see print as a powerful communication tool and aim to use design to encourage this.

I'm also passionate about collaborating with other creatives to make work that can explore the themes and ideas behind their practice.

NAME: katie-harris
CATEGORIES: book  poster  blind embossing  print  photography  art direction  social desgin
DESCRIPTION: My work is a very observational practice focusing on unconsidered aspects of life and small social issues that tend to go unnoticed. My practice is very systematic, playful and data driven. I enjoy doing in-depth research to completely understand the subject before I try to tackle the problem. I then try to communicate the message or issue by including the chosen audience as much as possible. I believe that people understand better if they are included and can interact with the message that is trying to be communicated.

NAME: kayleigh-chan
DESCRIPTION: As a designer, I focus on combining digital aesthetics with hand-drawn illustration to tell a story. My work is influenced by current events in popular culture and society.

NAME: kendall-slade
DESCRIPTION: I'm Kendall. A multi-disciplinary designer based in London. Although my work isn't limited to it, I find myself most drawn to briefs and outcomes that use design methods to question and start conversations surrounding topics of digital technologies and the relationship society has with these. Often data plays a strong role in my practice, whether this involves analysing it, gathering it or manipulating it.

NAME: kenn-lam
DESCRIPTION: I work mainly with illustrations, often borrowing from my skillset as a graphic designer when it's appropriate. I'm mainly interested in the narrative aspect of image making. It helps me make sense of things I otherwise wouldn't understand.

NAME: kenzie-greene
DESCRIPTION: Using photography, particulary 35mm colour film in a design context.

NAME: kiran-sandhu
DESCRIPTION: As a designer, my work focuses on educating, informing and engaging audiences with the work that I produce. I like to work on complex issues and topics and break them down to become more understandable.  My Practice is extremely data and research-based and is tailored towards purpose and audience. My aim to always to see how the audience will preserve my work.

NAME: lawrence-scanlon
DESCRIPTION: Graphic and motion designer with an interest in technology and its capabilities for communication and education.

NAME: leonardo-pellegrino
DESCRIPTION: Leonardo is a multidisciplinary designer crossing bounderies between digital, print, art direction, and moving image.

NAME: lily-smallwood
CATEGORIES: data visualisation  printed matter  editorial  art direction  typography  publication  print
DESCRIPTION: I like to re-visualises things — conversation, topics, data, emotions, situations and anything else I feel is compelling and relevant. My work is usually created through printed matter, paying strong detail to typography, shape, composition and colour.

NAME: liza-gusarova
DESCRIPTION: My practice is fuelled by experimentation, focusing on both collaboration with people and collaborations of mediums in order to push the audience’s expectation of design. The work I produce is concept driven rather than centred around a specific visual style, with every project targeting a theme that aims makes you think, presented to you in a new way.

NAME: lucie-corbasson-guevenoux
DESCRIPTION: As a graphic designer and illstrator I love  hte idea to have the possibility to share, create feelings and emotions trhough a medium but aware people about subjects may be in a more pleasant way for the eyes.

NAME: luisa-carneiro-pacheco
DESCRIPTION: My interests are between digital and interactive design with the purpose of promoting a change of human behaviour.

NAME: maki-umeda
DESCRIPTION: Concentrating on specific shapes can allow us to find meaning in photographs, which differs from the meaning that those photographs initially had. I hope that looking at these pictures through the shapes I have recognised in them, my audience will ask themselves questions about their real meaning.

NAME: malone-chen
DESCRIPTION: My design practice starts with traditional graphic design but with interests in exploring and experimenting with new technologies. The work I have been creating centres around digital, playful and collaborative experiences.

NAME: marina-melikyan
DESCRIPTION: I am an inter-diciplinary graphic communication designer. My work is mostly based around installation, photography, and print and it is driven by experimentation, research and conceptual thinking. My main area of interest is the line between the digital and analogue mediums, the transition between the physical and screen based and human-technology interactions.

NAME: marta-zenka-
DESCRIPTION: I’m a designer and illustrator fascinated with visual perception, my work is driven by context, research and free experimentation.

NAME: molly-wright
DESCRIPTION: Particularly interested in idea of subversion and abstraction as means to articulate the everyday.

NAME: nanako-shinomoto
DESCRIPTION: I doodle. My illustration is weird and gross-cute because I’ve inherited a great culture of Hentai. Combining illustrations with digital technologies is my biggest interest.

NAME: naomi-ferne-patterson
DESCRIPTION: My work explores human behaviour, identity and culture, i explore these using photography, film, and print-making. Collaboration is a driving point for my work and i am interested in co-optive ways of presenting my subjects. My most recent work looks at the relationship between dance and design combining both arts together.

NAME: nash-kasic
CATEGORIES: animation photography interactive campaign publication typography
DESCRIPTION: I’m intrigued in using different approaches and materials to discover interesting outcomes. Exploring complex social issues and informing and educating audiences is a passion of mine. I’m always looking for the next thing to inspire me in all things strange, fun and new!

NAME: nathalie-de-vallière
DESCRIPTION: Merging design and code to create engaging, meaningful experiences. Always trying to make things more beautiful than they need to be.

NAME: olivia-lightfoot
DESCRIPTION: My practice revolves around Moving Image, however I am diverse in my exploration of mediums and materials. I focus on abstract concept art film, and its portrayal through light and colour within the cinematography and postpreduction.

NAME: paula-colls
DESCRIPTION: Carolina and Paula, a creative team interested in generating a positive social impact. We believe that through simplicity we can create meaningful messages.

NAME: phoebe-brown
DESCRIPTION: I am a multidisciplinary designer. I use photography to create work with a personal narrative - focusing on documenting other people's lives and experiences. I use illustration to highlight popular culture and inform society of important social issues.

NAME: rachelle-tan
DESCRIPTION: My practice is a blend of work inspired by small complexities in the world around me. Through my work I hope to bring a new perspective by sparking conversations and raising issues in a social context. My design approach is very visual yet theoretical and I believe in discovering hidden potentials of various mediums and techniques to communicate and engage on multiple levels.

NAME: rianne-ho
DESCRIPTION: Inspired by day-to-day data; creating visual narratives & systems that spark conversation

NAME: sarah-harte
DESCRIPTION: I like to use bright colours and graphic patterns throughout my work and try to make my illustrations eye-catching. I enjoy the fun colours and graphics but also I try to use this attention- grabbing and approachable style as a tool to engage people in subject matter that may not be so approachable, such as (but not limited to!) pathology. I have a great interest in anything quirky and love to introduce people to unique things and create accessibility and conversation around ‘intimidating’ topics.

NAME: seokyung-cho
DESCRIPTION: I love creating stories for younger audience.

NAME: seung-hyun-kim
DESCRIPTION: As an advertising designer, aim to use the power of creativity to inflence people to change and make the world a better place.

NAME: sheng-chia-huang-(finn)
DESCRIPTION: Documentary the whole process of film 404 (photography)

NAME: sherwin-teo
DESCRIPTION: One half of the Sherwin + Conrad Advertising duo. Ex Soldier. As Creatives soon to be out in the industry, we feel that it’s extremely important to be able to communicate and understand culture in hundreds of ever-changing ways. We try our best to seekout previously unexplored territories, insights and executions in advertising. We favour outcomes which stay true to our original insights and aren’t forcibly stretched across unnecessary media.

NAME: sophie-robin
DESCRIPTION: I enjoy combining digital aesthetics with handmade techniques and commenting of social, environmental and political issues. My work centres around turning complex issues into more approachable communication methods.

NAME: sterling-chang
DESCRIPTION: I create still / moving images.  Enjoy experimenting with unconventional methods of image making. I aim to translate human emotions and behaviours into sensory experiences.

NAME: suki-wang
DESCRIPTION: My practice focuses on combining space and information design and create something AMAZIMG. Culture study is the major topic for my practice, growing up all around the world it allows my to have a new idea towards culture.

NAME: texas-maragh
DESCRIPTION: My work aims to engage people in a playful interactive experience. I gain my inspiration and influences from contemporary culture and the urban environment, focusing on the streets I travel daily. Observation is a big part of my practice as I am interested in ‘the everyday’, ‘the normal’ and ‘the unseen’ - my objective is to make people see things they don’t see or take for granted, in a new and interesting way. Photography, print, technology, illustration and colour are all elements that characterise my work. I enjoy creating engaging interactive humorous experiences through the sense of play and enquiry.

NAME: thomas-hedger
CATEGORIES: installation  print  poster  art direction  print-making  illustration

NAME: tian-luo
DESCRIPTION: I would love to make a campaign into a playable experience, and I hope that my audience would enjoy the executions.

NAME: vera-romanova
DESCRIPTION: I design, direct and create moving images. My work evolves around cultures, traditions and sustainable living. My main goal as a graphic communication designer is to deliver information to my audience through appropriate tools.

NAME: yiruo-zhang
DESCRIPTION: My

NAME: yiu-ying-tsang
CATEGORIES: publication  print  interactive  digital  installation  photography
DESCRIPTION: My works aim to provide a playful interactive experience to the audiences.

NAME: yolanda-santamaria
DESCRIPTION: As a graphic designer my work aims to inform, educate, engage and raise awareness mainly of social issues.

NAME: mercedes-quezada
CATEGORIES: film  art direction  curation  photography  publication
DESCRIPTION: As a multidisciplinary designer, my work aims to engage multiple audiences, crossing boundaries between moving image, art direction and graphic design.

NAME: matthew-alex-taylor
DESCRIPTION: As a designer my main areas of interest are film, animation and motion graphics, particularly 3D graphics. However I do also have passion for interactive design and like to immerse and engage my audience with my work.
